is a 2012 Japanese drama film adaptation of a novel of the same name written by Misumi Kubo. It was released in Japan on 17 November. The film stars Kento Nagayama as Takumi Saito, the lead hero; Tomoko Tabata as Satomi Okamoto (Anzu), the lead heroine; Masataka Kubota as Ryota Fukuda; and Takahiro Miura as Yoshifumi Taoka. The film was directed by Yuki Tanada.
Reception
Tomoko Tabata won the 67th Mainichi Film Award for Best Actress for her role in the film.
